SEARCH
Module brickGame
Package com.brickbreakergame

Class Main

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.brickbreakergame.Main
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameEngine.OnAction, EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>
public class Main extends javafx.application.Application implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>, GameEngine.OnAction
The Main class represents the main entry point for the Brick Game application. It handles the game's logic, UI components, and user input. The game features a paddle, a ball, blocks to destroy, and various power-up bonuses. Players aim to clear all blocks in each level while keeping the ball from falling to the floor and managing their heart lives. The game progresses through levels of increasing difficulty. This class extends the Application class and implements EventHandler and GameEngine.OnAction interfaces.
Since:
12 December 2023

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Initializes and displays the main game window. This method sets up the primary stage of the game, including the main menu and game scenes.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage for this application, onto which the scene is set.

    • getRoot

      public javafx.scene.layout.Pane getRoot()
      Retrieves the root pane of the game's user interface.

      This method returns the primary container for all graphical elements in the game. The root pane is where all UI components like the paddle, ball, blocks, and other interactive elements are added and managed. It serves as the main canvas for the game's graphical rendering and user interaction.

      Returns:
      The root Pane object containing the game's UI elements.

    • initializeGameObjects

      protected void initializeGameObjects()
      Initializes the ball object with default properties and position. The ball is a central game element used in gameplay mechanics. This method sets its initial size, appearance, and starting position.

    • newGame

      public void newGame(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Starts a new game session. This method initializes the game objects, sets up the game board, UI components, and begins the game engine.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage used to display the game.

    • handle

      public void handle(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles keyboard input events. This method responds to paddle movement.
      Specified by:
      handle in interface javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent representing the player's keyboard input.

    • resetCollideFlags

      public void resetCollideFlags()
      Resets flags that track ball collisions with various objects. This is essential for ensuring proper response to new collisions after a collision has occurred and to prevent incorrect collision handling.

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate()
      Called on every frame update of the game. This method updates the game state, including UI components, game object positions, and handles collisions.
      Specified by:
      onUpdate in interface GameEngine.OnAction

    • onPhysicsUpdate

      public void onPhysicsUpdate()

      Specified by:
      onPhysicsUpdate in interface GameEngine.OnAction

    • onTime

      public void onTime(long time)
      Callback method for tracking game time. This method is used to update time-dependent aspects of the game, such as power-ups and game timers.
      Specified by:
      onTime in interface GameEngine.OnAction
      Parameters:
      time - The current game time in milliseconds.

    • setBallVelocityX

      public void setBallVelocityX(double ballVelocityX)
      Sets the horizontal velocity of the ball. This method is crucial for controlling the ball's speed and direction along the X-axis, typically in response to collisions or game events.
      Parameters:
      ballVelocityX - The new horizontal velocity for the ball. Positive values move the ball to the right, negative to the left.

    • setDestroyedBlockCount

    • getEngine

      public GameEngine getEngine()
      Retrieves the instance of the GameEngine.

      This method provides access to the GameEngine object, which is responsible for managing the main loop of the game. It controls game timing, updates game states, and orchestrates the rendering process. By accessing the GameEngine, other components of the game can interact with the core game loop, such as starting, stopping, or pausing the game.

      Returns:
      The current instance of GameEngine being used by the game.

    • isHeartBlockExist

      public boolean isHeartBlockExist()
      Checks if a heart block exists in the game.

      The heart block is a special game element that affects the gameplay by providing additional lives to the player when destroyed.

      Returns:
      True if a heart block exists in the current game level, false otherwise.

      Checks if there has been a collision with the right wall.
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision with the right wall, false otherwise.

    • isCollideToLeftWall

      public boolean isCollideToLeftWall()
      Checks if there has been a collision with the left wall.
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision with the left wall, false otherwise.

    • isCollideToRightBlock

      public boolean isCollideToRightBlock()
      Checks if there has been a collision with a right block.
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision with a right block, false otherwise.

    • isCollideToBottomBlock

      public boolean isCollideToBottomBlock()
      Checks if there has been a collision with a bottom block.
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision with a bottom block, false otherwise.

    • isCollideToLeftBlock

      public boolean isCollideToLeftBlock()
      Checks if there has been a collision with a left block.
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision with a left block, false otherwise.

    • isCollideToTopBlock

      public boolean isCollideToTopBlock()
      Checks if there has been a collision with the top block.
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision with a top block, false otherwise.

    • getGameState

      public GameController getGameState()
      Retrieves the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      The current state of the game as a GameController object.

    • setGoRightBall

      public void setGoRightBall(boolean goRightBall)
      Determines the horizontal movement direction of the ball. Setting this to true makes the ball move towards the right side of the screen.
      Parameters:
      goRightBall - True to make the ball move to the right, false for moving it to the left.

    • setCollideToBreak

      public void setCollideToBreak(boolean collideToBreak)
      Sets the collision status leading to a break.
      Parameters:
      collideToBreak - True if there is a collision leading to a break, false otherwise.

    • setCollideToBreakAndMoveToRight

      public void setCollideToBreakAndMoveToRight(boolean collideToBreakAndMoveToRight)
      Sets the collision status leading to a break and a subsequent move to the right.
      Parameters:
      collideToBreakAndMoveToRight - True if there is such a collision, false otherwise.

    • setCollideToRightWall

      public void setCollideToRightWall(boolean collideToRightWall)
      Sets the collision status for the ball with the right wall. When set to true, it indicates that the ball has collided with the right boundary of the game area.
      Parameters:
      collideToRightWall - True to indicate a collision with the right wall, false otherwise.

    • setCollideToLeftWall

      public void setCollideToLeftWall(boolean collideToLeftWall)
      Sets the collision status for the ball with the left wall. When set to true, it indicates that the ball has collided with the left boundary of the game area.
      Parameters:
      collideToLeftWall - True to indicate a collision with the left wall, false otherwise.

    • setCollideToRightBlock

      public void setCollideToRightBlock(boolean collideToRightBlock)
      Sets the collision status for the ball with a block on the right. This status is used in the game's logic to determine the ball's movement after hitting a block on its right side.
      Parameters:
      collideToRightBlock - True if the ball collides with a block on the right, false otherwise.

    • setCollideToBottomBlock

      public void setCollideToBottomBlock(boolean collideToBottomBlock)
      Sets the collision status for the ball with a block at the bottom. This is used for handling the ball's behavior after it collides with any block located below it.
      Parameters:
      collideToBottomBlock - True to indicate a collision with a block at the bottom, false otherwise.

    • setCollideToLeftBlock

      public void setCollideToLeftBlock(boolean collideToLeftBlock)
      Sets the collision status for the ball with a block on the left. It controls the game mechanics in terms of how the ball reacts after hitting a block to its left.
      Parameters:
      collideToLeftBlock - True if the ball collides with a block on the left, false otherwise.

    • setCollideToTopBlock

      public void setCollideToTopBlock(boolean collideToTopBlock)
      Sets the status of collision between the ball and a top block. This method is crucial for determining the ball's rebound direction after hitting a block above it.
      Parameters:
      collideToTopBlock - True if there is a collision with a top block, false otherwise.

    • setCenterBreakX

      public void setCenterBreakX(double centerBreakX)
      Sets the X-coordinate for the center point of the paddle's breaking action. This is used to determine the impact point of the ball on the paddle and calculate the ball's rebound trajectory.
      Parameters:
      centerBreakX - The X-coordinate of the paddle's center breaking point.

    • getBall

      public javafx.scene.shape.Circle getBall()
      Retrieves the ball object used in the game. The ball is a central element in gameplay, and this method provides access to its properties.
      Returns:
      The Circle object representing the ball in the game.

    • getGameEngine

      protected GameEngine getGameEngine()
      Retrieves the instance of the GameEngine used in the Main class.

      The GameEngine is a critical component that drives the game's main loop, handling the timing and sequencing of game events, updates, and rendering. This method provides access to the GameEngine, allowing other components or classes within the game to interact with the central game loop, such as starting or stopping the game, or querying the game's current state.

      Returns:
      The GameEngine instance currently in use by the Main class.
